claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: Type I interferon response score (normalized units) 3.1 vs 1.0 Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination creates broader antigen display by expanding the fraction of tumor proteins represented in the immunopeptidome.

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome 62.3% vs 37.3% Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome 40.6% vs 20.6% Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases after mRNA vaccination, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue 2.4x vs 1.0x Checkpoint axis became more targetable
The paper investigates whether intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine can create an interferon-rich inflammatory state that improves sensitivity to anti-PD-L1 therapy.

claims.caveat: The combination effect was tested in murine models; translation to human tumors requires prospective validation.

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with improved survival in metastatic patients receiving immune checkpoint inhibitor treatment.

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value p=0.01 Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients; tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation.

claims.claim: Combined intratumoral mRNA vaccination and checkpoint blockade increases CD8+ T-cell infiltration in tumors.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change 1.8x vs 1.0x Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy
Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.
